required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Observatoire du Portage rhinopharyngé de Streptococcus Pneumoniae (Sp) Chez Des Nourrissons Ayant Une Otite Moyenne aiguë (OMA) et Sains - Etude Ancillaire Sur la détection Des Porteurs de E Coli BLSE

lead_sponsor.agency: Association Clinique Thérapeutique Infantile du val de Marne

clinical_study.source: Association Clinique Thérapeutique Infantile du val de Marne

brief_summary.textblock: This nasopharyngeal (NP) carriage surveillance study was requested by the European Agency for the Evaluation of Medicinal Products as a post-licensing commitment to determine whether the use of the pneumococcal conjugate vaccines (PCVs) including 7 then 13 valents (introduced in 2001 and 2010, respectively) caused a shift in the distribution of Streptococcus pneumoniae serotypes in children with acute otitis media and modified the resistance of this bacterial species to antibiotics.

detailed_description.textblock: Since September 2001, 121 pediatricians who are part of a research and teaching network (ACTIV) throughout France participated at this prospective study. From October to June of each subsequent year, children of both sexes suffering from suppurative acute otitis media (AOM) with fever and/or otalgia (in order to increase the probability of pneumococcal AOM), aged 6 to 24 months, were enrolled.

primary_outcome.measure: S. Pneumoniae colonisation to detect emerging serotypes
primary_outcome.description: The percentage of children colonised by non vaccine serotypes -

secondary_outcome.measure: Detect the emergence of resistance S. pneumoniae
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of penicillin resistant S. pneumoniae

secondary_outcome.measure: Evaluation of the rhinopharyngeal carriage of other bacteria
secondary_outcome.description: Haemophilus influenzae, Moraxella Catarrhalis, and Staphylococcus aureus in AOM group and healthy children.

secondary_outcome.measure: Detect the emergence of new serotypes
secondary_outcome.description: > 10 Percent of isolated Sp, 5 percent of carrier children

arm_group.description: Nasopharyngeal sample for each enrrolled children

intervention.description: nasopharyngeal swabs from children with acute otitis media aged 6 to 24 months. The swabs were analyzed by the French National Reference Centre for Pneumococci.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- both sexes
- suffering from suppurative AOM
- age: 6 months to 24 months for AOM
- age: 6 months to 15 years for healthy children
- informed consent from parents or guardians
Exclusion Criteria:
- Children with antibiotic treatment within 7 days before enrolment,
- severe underlying disease,
- inclusion in the study during the previous 12 months

overall_official.affiliation: Association Clinique Thérapeutique Infantile du val de Marne
